## Description {#details}

<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> - Represent a constant reference to a string, i.e.

a character array and a length, which need not be null terminated.

This class does not own the string data, it is expected to be used in situations where the character data resides in some other buffer, whose lifetime extends past that of the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a>. For this reason, it is not in general safe to store a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a>.

Definition at line 51 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/adt/stringref-h">StringRef.h</a>.

### edit&#95;distance {#a51c1f447b5d754191564ae340ee4253b}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>unsigned StringRef::edit&#95;distance (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> Other, bool AllowReplacements=<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/basicaliasanalysis-cpp/#af6d5cafbdfc5313e65d990120021a3ec">true</a>, unsigned MaxEditDistance=0) const</>}
  labels = {["nodiscard"]}>
Determine the edit distance between this string and another string.

<ParametersList title="Parameters">
<ParametersListItem name="Other">the string to compare this string against.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="AllowReplacements">whether to allow character replacements (change one character into another) as a single operation, rather than as two operations (an insertion and a removal).</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="MaxEditDistance">If non-zero, the maximum edit distance that this routine is allowed to compute. If the edit distance will exceed that maximum, returns <code>MaxEditDistance+1</code>.</ParametersListItem>
</ParametersList>

<SectionUser title="Returns">
the minimum number of character insertions, removals, or (if <code>AllowReplacements</code> is <code>true</code>) replacements needed to transform one of the given strings into the other. If zero, the strings are identical.
</SectionUser>

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/adt/stringref-h/#l00220">220</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/adt/stringref-h">StringRef.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/stringref-cpp/#l00094">94</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/stringref-cpp">StringRef.cpp</a>.

## Helpful Algorithms

### consumeInteger {#a1643e7698ddbfd40fbd374a85f015846}

<MemberDefinition
  template={<>template &lt;typename T&gt;</>}
  prototype={<>bool llvm::StringRef::consumeInteger (unsigned Radix, T &amp; Result)</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Parse the current string as an integer of the specified radix.

If <code>Radix</code> is specified as zero, this does radix autosensing using extended C rules: 0 is octal, 0x is hex, 0b is binary.

If the string does not begin with a number of the specified radix, this returns true to signify the error. The string is considered erroneous if empty or if it overflows T. The portion of the string representing the discovered numeric value is removed from the beginning of the string.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/adt/stringref-h/#l00499">499</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/adt/stringref-h">StringRef.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### consumeInteger {#a8628d3c93731ec5ac11a4ca9dbc67dfb}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool StringRef::consumeInteger (unsigned Radix, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint">APInt</a> &amp; Result)</>}>
Parse the current string as an integer of the specified <code>Radix</code>.

If <code>Radix</code> is specified as zero, this does radix autosensing using extended C rules: 0 is octal, 0x is hex, 0b is binary.

If the string does not begin with a number of the specified radix, this returns true to signify the error. The string is considered erroneous if empty. The portion of the string representing the discovered numeric value is removed from the beginning of the string.

### getAsDouble {#a23753c04a4ada14fc9c4891d30ed5cdc}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool StringRef::getAsDouble (double &amp; Result, bool AllowInexact=<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/basicaliasanalysis-cpp/#af6d5cafbdfc5313e65d990120021a3ec">true</a>) const</>}>
Parse the current string as an IEEE double-precision floating point value.

The string must be a well-formed double.

If <code>AllowInexact</code> is false, the function will fail if the string cannot be represented exactly. Otherwise, the function only fails in case of an overflow or underflow, or an invalid floating point representation.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/adt/stringref-h/#l00546">546</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/adt/stringref-h">StringRef.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/stringref-cpp/#l00599">599</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/stringref-cpp">StringRef.cpp</a>.

### getAsInteger {#a1881146f2dcc2ca57c9c5f77f938db9d}

<MemberDefinition
  template={<>template &lt;typename T&gt;</>}
  prototype={<>bool llvm::StringRef::getAsInteger (unsigned Radix, T &amp; Result) const</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Parse the current string as an integer of the specified radix.

If <code>Radix</code> is specified as zero, this does radix autosensing using extended C rules: 0 is octal, 0x is hex, 0b is binary.

If the string is invalid or if only a subset of the string is valid, this returns true to signify the error. The string is considered erroneous if empty or if it overflows T.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/adt/stringref-h/#l00470">470</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/adt/stringref-h">StringRef.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### getAsInteger {#adc9c54d457a9ebc9d909c4b2234c7657}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool StringRef::getAsInteger (unsigned Radix, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint">APInt</a> &amp; Result) const</>}>
Parse the current string as an integer of the specified <code>Radix</code>, or of an autosensed radix if the <code>Radix</code> given is 0.

The current value in <code>Result</code> is discarded, and the storage is changed to be wide enough to store the parsed integer.


<SectionUser title="Returns">
true if the string does not solely consist of a valid non-empty number in the appropriate base.
</SectionUser>

APInt::fromString is superficially similar but assumes the string is well-formed in the given radix.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/adt/stringref-h/#l00526">526</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/adt/stringref-h">StringRef.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/stringref-cpp/#l00589">589</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/stringref-cpp">StringRef.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

</SectionDefinition>

### rsplit {#aca46fb04897a97747c13d75a06f1215a}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>std::pair&lt; StringRef, StringRef &gt; llvm::StringRef::rsplit (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> Separator) const</>}
  labels = {["inline", "nodiscard"]}>
Split into two substrings around the last occurrence of a separator string.

If <code>Separator</code> is in the string, then the result is a pair (LHS, RHS) such that (&#42;this == LHS + Separator + RHS) is true and RHS is minimal. If <code>Separator</code> is not in the string, then the result is a pair (LHS, RHS) where (&#42;this == LHS) and (RHS == &quot;&quot;).


<ParametersList title="Parameters">
<ParametersListItem name="Separator">- The string to split on.</ParametersListItem>
</ParametersList>

<SectionUser title="Returns">
- The split substrings.
</SectionUser>

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/adt/stringref-h/#l00733">733</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/adt/stringref-h">StringRef.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

Return a reference to the substring from &#91;Start, End).

<ParametersList title="Parameters">
<ParametersListItem name="Start">The index of the starting character in the substring; if the index is npos or greater than the length of the string then the empty substring will be returned.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="End">The index following the last character to include in the substring. If this is npos or exceeds the number of characters remaining in the string, the string suffix (starting with <code>Start</code>) will be returned. If this is less than <code>Start</code>, an empty string will be returned.</ParametersListItem>
</ParametersList>

### split {#af0284e4c41c0e09c0bc4767bc77a899d}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void StringRef::split (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> &gt; &amp; A, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> Separator, int MaxSplit=-1, bool KeepEmpty=<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/basicaliasanalysis-cpp/#af6d5cafbdfc5313e65d990120021a3ec">true</a>) const</>}>
Split into substrings around the occurrences of a separator string.

Each substring is stored in <code>A</code>. If <code>MaxSplit</code> is &gt;= 0, at most <code>MaxSplit</code> splits are done and consequently &lt;= <code>MaxSplit</code> + 1 elements are added to A. If <code>KeepEmpty</code> is false, empty strings are not added to <code>A</code>. They still count when considering <code>MaxSplit</code> An useful invariant is that Separator.join(A) == &#42;this if MaxSplit == -1 and KeepEmpty == true


<ParametersList title="Parameters">
<ParametersListItem name="A">- Where to put the substrings.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="Separator">- The string to split on.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="MaxSplit">- The maximum number of times the string is split.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="KeepEmpty">- True if empty substring should be added.</ParametersListItem>
</ParametersList>

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/adt/stringref-h/#l00754">754</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/adt/stringref-h">StringRef.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/stringref-cpp/#l00314">314</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/stringref-cpp">StringRef.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>
